intro: Boechera selbyi var. inyoensis, commonly known as the Inyo bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh conditions. Its leaves are basal and pinnately divided, with a hairy texture that helps reduce water loss. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological niche.
